creditline: Gift of James A. Bergquist, Boston, in honor of Rachel McGarry
description: portrait of a woman with her head turned toward PL, with her hair in a bun, with her neck and shoulder exposed
signed: In plate, lower right: A de Witte  /  1876
text: Adrien de Witte was one of the most respected artists of Liège in Belgium. As a young man he spent five years in Rome, where he resided at the Darchis Foundation, an institution founded in 1699 for the purpose of supporting young men from Liège in their efforts to study art and theology in Rome. He returned to Liège where he was appointed professor at the Academy of Fine Arts in 1885 and taught there until 1921. He was director of the Academy from 1910 to 1913.
title: [Woman with her hair in a bun]
